Subject: English
ASComponentText: By the end of Foundation, students listen to texts, interact with others and create short spoken texts, including retelling stories.

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They share thoughts and preferences, retell events and report information or key ideas to an audience.

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They use language features including words and phrases from learning and texts.

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They listen for and identify rhymes, letter patterns and sounds (phonemes) in words.

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They orally blend and segment phonemes in single-syllable words.

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They read, view and comprehend texts, making connections between characters, settings and events, and to personal experiences.

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They identify the language features of texts including connections between print and images.

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They name the letters of the English alphabet and know and use the most common sounds (phonemes) represented by these letters (graphs).

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They read words including consonant–vowel–consonant words and some high-frequency words.

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They create short written texts, including retelling stories using words and images where appropriate.

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They retell, report information and state their thoughts, feelings and key ideas.

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They use words and phrases from learning and texts.

Subject: English
ASComponentText: They form letters, spell most consonant–vowel–consonant words and experiment with capital letters and full stops.
